intro: Schmalhausenia eriophora, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Schmalhausenia eriophora is adapted to thrive in sandy, well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and forage for desert wildlife.
